description: Core utility classes providing helper methods for technician management, ticket operations, and application-wide functionality

components.TechnicianUtils: Static utility class providing helper methods for technician-related operations, status management, and display formatting.

rules: Static utility class with private constructor to prevent instantiation.
Technician initials generation: 'John Doe' -> 'JD', 'Mia' -> 'M', empty -> '?'.
Clock-in status checking using inverse isOff logic as temporary implementation.
Status determination: 'Not clocked in', 'Available', 'Currently busy' based on clock and availability.
Color-coded status indicators: textSecondary (not clocked), successGreen (available), warningOrange (busy).
Avatar color generation using consistent hash-based color assignment from predefined palette.
Display name formatting: 'John Doe' -> 'John D.' for compact representation.
Technician assignment eligibility checking: must be clocked in AND available.
List filtering methods: getAvailableTechnicians, getClockedInTechnicians for operational needs.
Availability-based sorting: available first, then busy, then clocked out, with name fallback.
Workload description generation for UI display: availability status with context.
Recommended technician selection with preferred technician priority and fallback logic.
Comprehensive helper methods supporting dashboard technician cards and assignment logic.
Future-ready design with notes for proper clock tracking enhancement.
Integration with app colors for consistent visual theming across technician UI elements.
Null safety implementation with proper error handling for empty names and missing data.
Functional programming approach with immutable operations and pure functions.
Business logic separation: utility methods handle display and calculation logic only.

components.TicketUtils: Static utility class providing helper methods for ticket operations, status management, calculations, and formatting.

rules: Static utility class with private constructor following singleton utility pattern.
Currency formatting with dollar sign and two decimal places for price display.
Status color mapping: completed/paid (successGreen), in-service (warningOrange), queued/assigned (primaryBlue).
Readable status label conversion: 'in-service' -> 'In Service' with proper capitalization.
Total service time calculation by summing all service durations in minutes.
Total ticket value calculation by summing all service base prices.
Priority system with record types: High (1), Medium (2), Low (3), Normal (default).
Checkout readiness validation: tickets with 'completed' or 'in-service' status eligible.
Overdue calculation with 15-minute buffer beyond expected service duration.
Services list formatting with truncation: shows max N services, '+X more' for overflow.
Color-coded priority indicators using app color scheme for consistency.
Business logic encapsulation for ticket-related calculations and validations.
Integration with Ticket model for accessing services, status, and timing data.
Helper methods supporting checkout screen, dashboard queue, and ticket management UI.
Time-based calculations with DateTime operations for overdue detection.
Flexible service list display with configurable truncation limits.
Status-driven UI logic supporting different ticket workflow states.
Currency and formatting utilities for consistent financial data presentation.

components.AppDateFormatter: Static utility class providing comprehensive date and time formatting methods for database storage and UI display.

components._DateRange: Private helper class for internal date range representation with start and end DateTime values.

rules: Static utility class with private constructor following singleton utility pattern.
ISO8601 database storage methods: toIso8601String() and fromIso8601String() for consistent database operations.
UTC conversion for database storage: all stored dates converted to UTC format for consistency.
Date-only string handling: supports both 'yyyy-MM-dd' and full timestamp formats during parsing.
Date range filtering methods: getStartOfDayIso8601() and getEndOfDayIso8601() for precise database queries.
Predefined date range generators: getToday(), getYesterday(), getThisWeek(), getLastWeek(), getThisMonth(), getLastMonth().
Week calculation using Monday-to-Sunday format with proper weekday offset calculations.
Month boundary handling: proper first/last day calculations including leap years and varying month lengths.
Time range formatting: smart AM/PM consolidation for ranges within same period (e.g., '9:00 - 10:30 AM').
Display date formatting: formatDisplayDate() shows year only when different from current year.
Date range display formatting: intelligent consolidation for same month/year ranges.
Full date formatting: 'EEEE, MMMM d, y' pattern for complete date representation.
Short date formatting: 'MMM d, y' pattern for compact date display.
Time formatting using DateFormat.jm() for locale-aware 12-hour time display.
Error handling with graceful fallbacks for malformed date strings.
Intl package integration for proper internationalization support.
Business logic separation: utility handles formatting only, no data persistence.
Used throughout app for consistent date handling in stores, widgets, and database operations.
